refnamediv.refpurpose: The ZendGuardEncodeTask is a wrapper for ZendGuard zendenc executable.

refentry.refsect1:
&ref.title.note;
It pre-compiles the PHP code which improves speed and can prevent unauthorized code modification.
Additionally it allows signing or licensing the code so it can only be used with a valid license.
For more information about ZendGuard encode parameters see the ZendGuard documentation.

&ref.title.attributes;
Attributes for ZendGuardEncodeTask
&taskAttributes.table.titlesLine.all;
zendEncoderPath
String
Path to zendenc or zendenc5 binary.
&attributes.defaultValue.NA;
&attributes.required.yes;
deleteSource
Boolean
Whether to delete the original file and replace with encoded.
true
&attributes.required.no;
renameSourceExt
String
If defined the original file will be copied to originalfile.renameSourceExt before encoding. This property overrides the deleteSource property.
&attributes.defaultValue.NA;
&attributes.required.no;
shortTags
Boolean
Turns on/off support for PHP short tags (<?). true to enable support.
true
&attributes.required.no;
aspTags
Boolean
Turns on/off support for ASP tags (<%). true to enable support.
false
&attributes.required.no;
noHeader
Boolean
Disables the PHP-compatible header that is added to the top of every encoded file by default and is displayed if the Zend Optimizer is not properly installed.
false
&attributes.required.no;
useCrypto
Boolean
Enables cryptography support.
false
&attributes.required.no;
encodedOnly
Boolean
If enabled the encoded files will only work with other encoded files ( I.e. encoded and not-encoded files cannot be used together).
false
&attributes.required.no;
forceEncode
Boolean
Allow encoding previously encoded files. Not recommended.
false
&attributes.required.no;
expires
String
Make an encoded file to expire on the given data. Date is in yyyy-mm-dd format.
&attributes.defaultValue.NA;
&attributes.required.no;
obfuscationLevel
Integer
Level of obfuscation. Defaults to 0 (no obfuscation).
0
&attributes.required.no;
optMask
Integer
Optimization mask. Integer representing a bit mask.
&attributes.defaultValue.NA;
&attributes.required.no;
privateKeyPath
String
Path to the company private key. This is required when either signProduct or licenseProduct is enabled.
&attributes.defaultValue.NA;
&attributes.required.no;
licenseProduct
Boolean
Enabled product licensing. The encoded files won't work without a valid license. If enabled privateKeyPath property also needs to be defined.
false
&attributes.required.no;
signProduct
Boolean
Enabled product signing. If signing is enabled the files will be encoded with license support. However valid license won't be required for the files to work. If enabled privatKeyPath property also needs to be defined.
false
&attributes.required.no;
productName
String
Name of the product. This must match the product name in the license and is required when either licenseProduct or signProduct is enabled.
&attributes.defaultValue.NA;
&attributes.required.no;
prologFile
String
Path to a file containing a text that will be prepended to each encoded file and displayed in case the Zend Optimizer is not installed.
&attributes.defaultValue.NA;
&attributes.required.no;

&ref.title.example;
<zendguardencode shortTags="false" productName="Phing" privateKeyPath="/var/data/phing.key" licenseProduct="true" zendEncoderPath="/usr/local/Zend/ZendGuard-5_0_1/bin/zendenc5" >
<fileset dir="src"> <include name="**/*.php" /> <exclude name="cache/**" /> <exclude name="plugins/**" /> </fileset>
<fileset dir="src"> <include name="plugins/cs*/**/*.php" /> <include name="plugins/cs*/*.php" /> </fileset> </zendguardencode>
Encode all php files in the current directory and subdirectories.
Exclude everything in cache/ and plugins/ but include everything in plugins that starts with cs.
